name: Cyclops v1-dv1, 2021
description:
Cyclops is a misunderstood villain of mythology. I envision them as a beautiful monster, a power figure. Here they stand regal, carved from yellow stone, atop a symbolically presented ancient temple made from moss patina'd mud from their home island.
View this in AR on mobile. Pan the view to see all of the details: SHIFT-click on desktop or two finger drag on mobile.

Cyclops first appeared in my solo show "Year Zero" at bitforms gallery, NYC. This re-minting is in honor of the reappearance of this digital sculpture in my exhibition "👁" at Art Mûr gallery, Montreal.
